etymologies: early 17th century; earliest use found in William Shakespeare (1564–1616), playwright and poet. From Dutch baviaan, †baviaen baboon

definitions: Usually with capital initial. A character in a morris dance representing a baboon, and typically engaging in wild, foolish, or lewd behaviour.
A baboon; specifically (South African) the chacma, Papio ursinus. Also figurative (derogatory): a fool, an idiot. Compare "babion".
